result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald Jerome Thein was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample.  The Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of probation in case 22CF1843.  Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donald Jerome Thein

records.addlTxt:
Statements by the State, Defense and Defendant.  Additional statements by: Stephen Peters. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 142 DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for 142 DAYS. A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

The Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample.  The Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of probation in case 22CF1843.  Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.

Appellate rights given to defendant.

Defendant Donald Jerome Thein appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Donald Jerome Thein.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.  Defendant sworn. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.  

Sentencing proceeded.
Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights and Addendum, filed.

Defendant Donald Jerome Thein not in court, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Donald Jerome Thein.  Prosecuting attorney Ryan Jay Michaels in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a final pre-trial. Defendant has a pending matter in Branch 2. Court will accept transfer of that case or authorize transfer of this case for the purpose of a global resolution. Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing hearing. Court vacates the jury trial on 10/17/22. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.
State's Motions in Limine, received and filed.
State's Witness List, received and filed.

Attorney Katherine Graber in court, defendant Donald Jerome Thein not in court, in custody.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Katherine Graber in court, defendant Donald Jerome Thein not in court, in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
MATTER HEARD OFF THE RECORD. Defense counsel requests a scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with SCB (9/27/72)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Donald Jerome Thein in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Donald Jerome Thein in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Donald Jerome Thein appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
